title: Severe weather, including a squall line of thunderstorms, possible in Kansas City area
author: Robert A. Cronkleton
excerpt: A squall line of thunderstorms could develop along a cold front that is expected to sweep through the Kansas City area Tuesday evening, according to the National Weather Service.
abstract:
Severe weather including strong winds, large hail and maybe a tornado or two is possible in the Kansas City area Tuesday as a couple rounds of thunderstorms sweep through Missouri, according to the National Weather Service.
While central and northeast Missouri are at greater risk of seeing high impact severe weather, the National Weather Service's Storm Prediction Center has placed Kansas City and surrounding area under a slight risk of severe thunderstorms. The rating means that scattered severe storms are possible, but are not expect to be widespread.

title: Memphis likely to see severe weather Friday: Here's what to know
author: Dima Amro
excerpt: Memphis will likely see severe weather Friday with the possibility of thunderstorms, tornadoes and hail, according to the National Weather Service.
abstract:
The Memphis area Friday stands at a moderate risk for severe weather and will likely see severe storms as well as possible tornadoes and hail, according to the National Weather Service in Memphis.
Friday afternoon and evening will see the highest risk of severe weather, continuing into Saturday until about 1 a.m., according to NWS Memphis.
Beginning Thursday night, temperatures will dip to 60 degrees and Shelby County will see storm clouds roll in with a 60% chance of showers and thunderstorms between 2 a.

title: More severe weather in North Texas Tuesday forecast with large hail, tornadoes possible
author: Harriet Ramos
excerpt: Storms will be possible beginning Tuesday afternoon, but the greatest threat for severe storms is around 2 a.m. Wednesday along and east of Interstate 35.
abstract:
The threat of severe weather returns to the North Texas forecast on Tuesday with the possibility of large hail, damaging winds and tornadoes, according to the National Weather Service in Fort Worth.
There is also an elevated fire threat west of Interstate 35 behind a dryline, officials said.
Madi Gordon, a NWS meteorologist, said some storms may develop late Tuesday afternoon ahead of they dryline along and east of I-35, with a second round possible early Wednesday morning.
If storms do develop Tuesday, Gordon said, all manner of weather, including large hail, damaging winds and tornadoes are possible.

title: Thunderstorms, gusty winds expected in CT Saturday, weather service says
author: Austin Mirmina
excerpt: Warnings of thunderstorms, gusty winds and hail have been issued for five of the state's...
abstract:
Steady showers and warmer-than-average temperatures during the day are expected to transition into evening thunderstorms and hazardous conditions throughout Connecticut on Saturday, the national weather service says.

The weather service forecasts that morning rain and breezy winds across the state will last throughout the day, with thunderstorms possible in the mid-afternoon. Temperatures will be in the mid-to-high 60s, which is several degrees warmer on average for April.

Daytime precipitation amounts could range from a quarter to a half of an inch, depending on the location, according to the national weather service.

title: Kansas City under severe thunderstorm watch Tuesday evening until midnight: NWS
author: Bill Lukitsch
excerpt: Potential threats include tornadoes, tennis-ball-sized hail and wind gusts as high as 70 miles per hour.
abstract:
The National Weather Service was warning Kansas Citians of potentially dangerous weather on Tuesday evening as the metro area was put on notice for severe thunderstorms, tornadoes and heavy hail.
The weather service placed Kansas City and several parts of northwestern Missouri and northeastern Kansas under a severe thunderstorm watch. The latest warning comes amid strong storms observed Tuesday evening in Holt County, north of St. Joseph.
Under the thunderstorm watch, the weather service advised of one or two tornadoes as a possibility, along with scattered hail the size of tennis balls.

title: Nashville weather: Severe storms, high winds possible overnight in Middle TN
author: Rachel Wegner
excerpt: Severe storms are expected to push through Middle Tennessee late Friday night into early Saturday morning. Follow along here for updates.
abstract:
The risk of severe storms kicks off late Friday night across Middle Tennessee.
Strong to severe storms will be moving into the Middle Tennessee area between 9 p.m. Friday and 3 a.m. Saturday, according to the Nashville Weather Service.
Here's the latest on tonight's severe weather risk. Our messaging has not changed. Damaging straight-line winds are the primary threat with gusts of 60+ mph. Isolated tornadoes can't be ruled out,. 
#TNwx
 
pic.twitter.com/iG9yq7PEh5
— NWS Nashville (@NWSNashville) 
March 31, 2023
Damaging straight-line winds will be the primary threat, with winds up to 60 mph.

title: Severe weather possible in the Tri-State on Friday evening
excerpt: The National Weather Service says severe weather is possible in the Tri-State on Friday evening.
abstract:
The National Weather Service says severe weather is possible in the Tri-State on Friday evening as a potent springtime storm system sweeps through the region.
Here's what they're saying about the forecast.
A couple of the ingredients needed for severe weather − wind shear and moisture − will be readily available, according to the weather service. Justin Gibbs, a meteorlogist for the agency, said the big question is whether there will be enough instability to fuel severe thunderstorms.
High temperatures are expected to reach the upper 60s on Friday, and it's going to feel muggy by March standards, with dew points in the lower 60s.

title: First Alert Weather: All severe threats possible across North Texas today
author: Dominic Brown
excerpt: Your CBS News Texas First Alert Weather Team is keeping a close eye on a likely active weather day in North Texas this afternoon and evening. In fact, all modes of severe weather are possible.
abstract:
NORTH TEXAS (CBSNewsTexas.com) — Heads up! Today is a Weather Alert.

Your CBS News Texas First Alert Weather Team is keeping a close eye on a likely active weather day in North Texas this afternoon and evening. In fact, all modes of severe weather are possible.

The Storm Prediction Center has posted an Enhanced Risk (Level 3) for severe storms in most of North Texas, including all of the Metroplex.

This afternoon, let's stay weather aware. A warm front will continue pushing through our viewing area from the south while the dryline nudges into the area from the west.

title: Severe weather outbreak with tornadoes could impact 20 states late this week
author: FOX Weather
excerpt: The highest severe weather threat on Friday is predicted to stretch from Iowa and Illinois southward into Arkansas, northern Mississippi and West and Middle Tennessee. Tornadoes, damaging wind gust…
abstract:
March won't be going out like a lamb this year as a potential severe weather outbreak looms for the Plains, Midwest and South to close out the month, less than a week after a 
deadly tornado outbreak 
tore across Mississippi, Alabama and Georgia last Friday night and into the weekend.


The setup for severe weather can be traced back to a bomb cyclone that has brought another round of rain, snow and wind to California over the last few days. The upper-level jet stream disturbance responsible for this West Coast storm will sweep into the central U.

abstract:
According to the latest weather forecasts, a sunny outlook is expected in the United Kingdom this week after experiencing rounds of heavy rain and winter storms.
 
Motorists and travelers this week could expect a sunny weather that is best for outdoor activities and travel.

The risk of severe storms kicks off late Friday night across Middle Tennessee.

Damaging straight-line winds will be the primary threat, with winds up to 60 mph.
Isolated threats of tornadoes will be highest over the southwest portions of Middle Tennessee.

title: Arkansas school districts monitoring Friday weather
author: DMM
excerpt: Arkansas school districts are keeping a close watch on the possibility of severe storms Friday.
abstract:
Arkansas school districts are keeping a close watch on the possibility of severe storms Friday.
The district is constantly watching the weather, Shari Cooper, PR and communications manager for Fort Smith Public Schools, said.
Load Error
If you feel more comfortable keeping your child home until the weather passes, that's up to you, she said.
The district has safe rooms at every school.
"The Fort Smith Public School system has safe rooms and tornado shelters at all of our schools," Cooper said. "Every single school has that capacity to bring our students into the safe places during severe weather.

title: Tornadoes, large hail, strong winds possible as strong thunderstorms sweep through KC
author: Robert A. Cronkleton
excerpt: With the threat of severe weather including the possibility of tornadoes on Tuesday, the National Weather Service advises to pay attention to the forecast as it will change.
abstract:
Another round of severe weather is expected to sweep through the Kansas City area this week, bringing strong thunderstorms that could generate large hail, strong winds and tornadoes, according to the National Weather Service.
The timing of the storms will be Tuesday afternoon and evening. While central and northeast Missouri are at a greater risk of seeing the severe weather, a few tornadoes cannot be ruled out in the Kansas City metro area, the weather service said.
'It's imperative everyone keep up to date on the latest forecast, as details will emerge and change as we approach Tuesday afternoon,' the National Weather Service said.

abstract:

Mark Kennedy

iPhone in Canada
) reads, "Anyone else having constant issues with the weather widget on @Apple #iPhone not loading? It's happening all the time and needs to be opened to make it work. I'm on #iPhone14Pro fully updated."
The widget for the iPhone home screen simply states "No weather data.

title: Is having extreme weather the new normal?
author: Steph Mcafee
excerpt: State Climatologist and Associate Professor of Geography Steph McAfee shares her professional opinion on extreme weather
abstract:
Find more answers here!
 
 
The United States Department of Agriculture defines weather-related extreme events as those that are often short-lived and include heat waves, freezes, heavy downpours, tornadoes, tropical cyclones and floods.With strange weather occurring across the country, it is hard not to think that erratic weather patterns are becoming more frequent.
A 
climate article
 from National Public Radio highlighted that the Bulletin of the American Meteorological Society published 'Explaining Extreme Events of 2021 and 2022 from a Climate Perspective.

Strong tornadoes, large hail and destructive winds are possible Friday during a severe weather outbreak that could rip through as many as 20 states. The risk of severe storms stretches from southern Minnesota and Wisconsin southward into Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama.

abstract:
From the plethora of weather apps available on the Play Store, it can sometimes be a headache when choosing the best app for you. Staying up to date with the weather forecast is easier than ever in 2023, thanks to the abundance of weather apps available for Android users.

Some apps come with a clean user experience and support for various widgets. With the new Android versions rolling out, these apps are getting better each day, with options for customizability and accurate weather information.

With so many options available, determining which app is best for your needs can be difficult.

author: Filipe Espósito
excerpt: A beautiful new weather app called Perfect Weather for iOS launched this morning. Perfect Weather is designed for iOS 7, as it plays off of the updated color palette and uses the new weather icons…
abstract:
A beautiful new weather app called 
Perfect Weather
 for iOS launched this morning. Perfect Weather is designed for iOS 7, as it plays off of the updated color palette and uses the new weather icons introduced in iOS 7 Weather. However, Perfect Weather is a lot more in depth and informative than the default Weather app.


Upon opening Perfect Weather you can easily see the different locations in which you saved and view the weather for each. You can quickly add more locations by pressing the Edit button.
authors: Chance Miller,Filipe Espósito,Michael Grimes,Sarah Guarino,Seth Kurkowski,Zac Hall

title: Severe weather, including a squall line of thunderstorms, possible in Kansas City area
author: Robert A. Cronkleton
excerpt: A squall line of thunderstorms could develop along a cold front that is expected to sweep through the Kansas City area Tuesday evening, according to the National Weather Service.
abstract:
Severe weather including strong winds, large hail and maybe a tornado or two is possible in the Kansas City area Tuesday as a couple rounds of thunderstorms sweep through Missouri, according to the National Weather Service.
While central and northeast Missouri are at greater risk of seeing high impact severe weather, the National Weather Service's Storm Prediction Center has placed Kansas City and surrounding area under a slight risk of severe thunderstorms. The rating means that scattered severe storms are possible, but are not expect to be widespread.

title: Rain-Wrapped Tornadoes, Damaging Wind Possible As Severe Storms Hit IL
author: Andrea Earnest
excerpt: The weather service said the severe weather threat is for 3 to 11 p.m. Friday.
abstract:
The weather service said the severe weather threat is for 3 to 11 p.m. Friday.

Reply

ILLINOIS — Severe thunderstorms are expected Friday as damaging winds and rain-wrapped tornadoes are possible, according to the National Service.

Most of the Chicago area is under a slight risk for severe weather, with areas to the west under an enhanced risk. In northwest Illinois, near the Iowa-Illinois border, the severe weather threat is moderate, according to the weather service.

The weather service said the severe weather threat is for 3 to 11 p.

title: Storms with hail, strong wind possible in North Texas on Thursday, Friday
author: Harriet Ramos
excerpt: The threat of severe weather in Dallas-Fort Worth is low Thursday, according to the NWS.
abstract:
Thunderstorms and some severe weather are possible in North Texas on Thursday and Friday, according to the National Weather Service in Fort Worth.
Residents could see some drizzle and light rain Thursday morning and there is a chance of thunderstorms in the afternoon, according to NWS meteorologist Sarah Barnes.
The chance of severe weather is low for the Dallas-Fort Worth area on Thursday, Barnes said. If severe storms do develop, they will likely be north of the Metroplex.
The greatest threat from those storms would be hail, according to Barnes.

title: More severe weather in North Texas Tuesday forecast with large hail, tornadoes possible
author: Harriet Ramos
excerpt: Storms will be possible beginning Tuesday afternoon, but the greatest threat for severe storms is around 2 a.m. Wednesday along and east of Interstate 35.
abstract:
The threat of severe weather returns to the North Texas forecast on Tuesday with the possibility of large hail, damaging winds and tornadoes, according to the National Weather Service in Fort Worth.
There is also an elevated fire threat west of Interstate 35 behind a dryline, officials said.
Madi Gordon, a NWS meteorologist, said some storms may develop late Tuesday afternoon ahead of they dryline along and east of I-35, with a second round possible early Wednesday morning.
If storms do develop Tuesday, Gordon said, all manner of weather, including large hail, damaging winds and tornadoes are possible.

title: National Weather Service dragged for 'Transgender Day of Visibility' tweet: 'Just do the weather'
author: Adam Sabes
excerpt: The National Weather Service is being hit on Twitter after promising 'International Transgender Day of Visibility" in a post on Friday.
abstract:
The National Weather Service was criticized on Twitter for promoting the "Transgender Day of Visibility."
"To promote justice, equality, and equity for the transgender community, the National Weather Service family champions and stands alongside our transgender employees on this day and every day!" the National Weather Service posted on Twitter on Friday.
Conservative columnist Buzz Patterson tweeted in response "Just do the weather. Thanks."
Comedian Tim young tweeted, "Stick to reporting on the weather.

title: Kansas City under severe thunderstorm watch Tuesday evening until midnight: NWS
author: Bill Lukitsch
excerpt: Potential threats include tornadoes, tennis-ball-sized hail and wind gusts as high as 70 miles per hour.
abstract:
The National Weather Service was warning Kansas Citians of potentially dangerous weather on Tuesday evening as the metro area was put on notice for severe thunderstorms, tornadoes and heavy hail.
The weather service placed Kansas City and several parts of northwestern Missouri and northeastern Kansas under a severe thunderstorm watch. The latest warning comes amid strong storms observed Tuesday evening in Holt County, north of St. Joseph.
Under the thunderstorm watch, the weather service advised of one or two tornadoes as a possibility, along with scattered hail the size of tennis balls.

title: Tornadoes, large hail, strong winds possible as strong thunderstorms sweep through KC
author: Robert A. Cronkleton
excerpt: With the threat of severe weather including the possibility of tornadoes on Tuesday, the National Weather Service advises to pay attention to the forecast as it will change.
abstract:
Another round of severe weather is expected to sweep through the Kansas City area this week, bringing strong thunderstorms that could generate large hail, strong winds and tornadoes, according to the National Weather Service.
The timing of the storms will be Tuesday afternoon and evening. While central and northeast Missouri are at a greater risk of seeing the severe weather, a few tornadoes cannot be ruled out in the Kansas City metro area, the weather service said.
'It's imperative everyone keep up to date on the latest forecast, as details will emerge and change as we approach Tuesday afternoon,' the National Weather Service said.

author: Kenneth John
excerpt: The latest weather forecast in the United Kingdom reported a sunny weather outlook this week after Brits experienced rounds of heavy rain and winter storms. Read here.
abstract:
According to the latest weather forecasts, a sunny outlook is expected in the United Kingdom this week after experiencing rounds of heavy rain and winter storms.
 
Motorists and travelers this week could expect a sunny weather that is best for outdoor activities and travel.
 
During the beginning of the year, Brits experienced severe winter storms and weather that resulted in weather alerts, challenging cold and travel hazards.
 
A sunny weather outlook is ahead in the UK

title: Advancements Series to Focus on Developments in Weather Forecast Technology
excerpt: JUPITER, Fla. (PRWEB) April 05, 2023 -- Learn how the power of artificial intelligence is improving accuracy over conventional forecasts.
abstract:
JUPITER, Fla. (PRWEB)
 
April 05, 2023
 
 An upcoming segment of Advancements with Ted Danson will discover how improvements in state-of-the-art weather forecast technology are helping businesses improve decision making.
 
With a look at the current volatile state of weather, Advancements will explore how innovations in technology are providing the insights needed to prepare for inclement weather. 
 
The show will learn how Excarta is using peer-reviewed state-of-the-art AI models to improve weather forecasting accuracy over conventional forecasts.

title: Is having extreme weather the new normal?
author: Steph Mcafee
excerpt: State Climatologist and Associate Professor of Geography Steph McAfee shares her professional opinion on extreme weather
abstract:
Find more answers here!
 
 
The United States Department of Agriculture defines weather-related extreme events as those that are often short-lived and include heat waves, freezes, heavy downpours, tornadoes, tropical cyclones and floods.With strange weather occurring across the country, it is hard not to think that erratic weather patterns are becoming more frequent.
A 
climate article
 from National Public Radio highlighted that the Bulletin of the American Meteorological Society published 'Explaining Extreme Events of 2021 and 2022 from a Climate Perspective.

title: Nashville weather: Middle TN expected to see severe weather Friday
author: Joyce Orlando
excerpt: Middle Tennessee could see severe storms for the second Friday in a row, according the National Weather Service. Here's what to expect.
abstract:
Forecasters warn of late-week severe weather threat
AccuWeather forecasters say a storm system will bring another round of severe weather to the South Central states late this week.
For the second Friday in a row, Middle Tennessee is expected to see severe weather, according to the National Weather Service.
Showers and thunderstorms
 in the area could bring severe storms and damaging winds Friday night into Saturday morning, according to NWS. With winds up to 60 mph and the possibility of a tornado.

title: iPhone weather app fix might come via iOS 16.4.1, and I can't wait for the update
author: Chris Smith
excerpt: The iPhone Weather app issues seem to be resolved, but Apple should release an iOS 16.4.1 update to fix iPhone bugs and issues soon.
abstract:
I first noticed the iPhone default Weather app issues a few weeks ago. The widget I had installed on the home screen would not load any information. I blamed it on a temporary spotty internet connection. Tapping the widget launched the app, which had the key data I needed. The app was working. A few days later, it happened again. And then earlier this week, 
the full Weather app crashed
, in addition to the corresponding widget.


It turned out it wasn't just me experiencing Weather app issues, as other iPhone users had the same problem.
authors: Andy Meek,Chris Smith,Jacob Siegal,Joshua Hawkins,José Adorno

title: The 25 best places to retire to in Georgia
author: Stacker
excerpt: Stacker compiled a list of the best counties to retire in Georgia using data from Niche.
abstract:
Buyers and sellers of real estate alike—when asked what are the three most essential considerations about a property—will nearly always reply "location, location, location." While this answer is sometimes tongue-in-cheek, it is often quite accurate, and this reply perhaps applies to retirees more than any other demographic. Settling down after a lifetime of working and perhaps raising a family calls for the perfect location: a spot where you can enjoy life with as few concerns as possible.
When seniors aged 65 years or older decide on where they want to live out their golden years, they consider very specific factors, such as the cost of living, government services, health care facilities, weather and overall climate, crime rate, outdoor recreational activities, eating establishments, cultural and entertainment opportunities, and more.

author: Rachel Wegner
excerpt: Middle Tennessee could see severe storms for the second Friday in a row, according the National Weather Service. Here's what to expect.
abstract:
Forecasters warn of late-week severe weather threat
AccuWeather forecasters say a storm system will bring another round of severe weather to the South Central states late this week.
For the second consecutive Friday, Middle Tennessee is expected to experience severe weather, according to the National Weather Service.
"Our main concern remains damaging straight-line winds with gusts 60+ mph," NWS Nashville said.
Though the risk for isolated tornadoes and hail are low, they cannot be ruled out. Localized, brief downpours are also possible, but widespread flooding is not expected, the forecast showed.

title: Apple's Weather App Is on the Fritz
author: Nikki Main
excerpt: The Apple weather app appears to be struggling to meet consumer expectations by simply not working. As more and more people rely on technology, we've become dependent on it for nearly everything,…
abstract:
The Apple weather app appears to be struggling to meet consumer expectations by simply not working. As more and more people rely on technology, we've become dependent on it for nearly everything, including the (usually) quick and easy step of referring to a weather app on our phone instead of stepping outside.
Nonetheless, we all fall victim to the information that is supposed to be available at our fingertips, but one click on Apple's weather app shows we may be forced to approach the day without knowing if the weather will shift.

title: Thunderstorms, gusty winds expected in CT Saturday, weather service says
author: Austin Mirmina
excerpt: Warnings of thunderstorms, gusty winds and hail have been issued for five of the state's...
abstract:
Steady showers and warmer-than-average temperatures during the day are expected to transition into evening thunderstorms and hazardous conditions throughout Connecticut on Saturday, the national weather service says.

The weather service forecasts that morning rain and breezy winds across the state will last throughout the day, with thunderstorms possible in the mid-afternoon. Temperatures will be in the mid-to-high 60s, which is several degrees warmer on average for April.

Daytime precipitation amounts could range from a quarter to a half of an inch, depending on the location, according to the national weather service.

title: Apple working to repair Weather app outage
author: Daniella Genovese
excerpt: Apple said some users may be affected by a temporary outage with its Weather app Tuesday morning. The app hasn't been loading weather information for many areas.
abstract:
Published
 April 4, 2023 11:44am EDT 
 
 
 
 
Tech giant Apple
 said it's trying to fix a temporary outage of its Weather app.
 
"We are currently working on a solution for the Weather app outage and will post an update online," Apple Support tweeted Tuesday morning. 
Scores of iPhone users recently reported having issues when opening the app, which provides live weather information and forecasts for regions around the world. 
 
Users from various regions reported that 
the weather information
 was not loading on the app, according to multiple reports.

title: Nashville weather: Severe storms, high winds possible overnight in Middle TN
author: Rachel Wegner
excerpt: Severe storms are expected to push through Middle Tennessee late Friday night into early Saturday morning. Follow along here for updates.
abstract:
The risk of severe storms kicks off late Friday night across Middle Tennessee.
Strong to severe storms will be moving into the Middle Tennessee area between 9 p.m. Friday and 3 a.m. Saturday, according to the Nashville Weather Service.
Here's the latest on tonight's severe weather risk. Our messaging has not changed. Damaging straight-line winds are the primary threat with gusts of 60+ mph. Isolated tornadoes can't be ruled out,. 
#TNwx
 
pic.twitter.com/iG9yq7PEh5
— NWS Nashville (@NWSNashville) 
March 31, 2023
Damaging straight-line winds will be the primary threat, with winds up to 60 mph.

title: Severe weather possible in the Tri-State on Friday evening
excerpt: The National Weather Service says severe weather is possible in the Tri-State on Friday evening.
abstract:
The National Weather Service says severe weather is possible in the Tri-State on Friday evening as a potent springtime storm system sweeps through the region.
Here's what they're saying about the forecast.
A couple of the ingredients needed for severe weather − wind shear and moisture − will be readily available, according to the weather service. Justin Gibbs, a meteorlogist for the agency, said the big question is whether there will be enough instability to fuel severe thunderstorms.
High temperatures are expected to reach the upper 60s on Friday, and it's going to feel muggy by March standards, with dew points in the lower 60s.

author: Aaron Barker

abstract:
Welcome to the Daily Weather Update from FOX Weather. It's Friday, March 31, 2023. Start your day the right way with everything you need to know about today's weather. You can also get a quick briefing of national, regional and local weather whenever you like with the FOX Weather Update podcast.
Strong tornadoes, large hail and destructive winds are possible Friday during a severe weather outbreak that could rip through as many as 20 states. The risk of severe storms stretches from southern Minnesota and Wisconsin southward into Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama.

abstract:
From the plethora of weather apps available on the Play Store, it can sometimes be a headache when choosing the best app for you. Staying up to date with the weather forecast is easier than ever in 2023, thanks to the abundance of weather apps available for Android users.

Some apps come with a clean user experience and support for various widgets. With the new Android versions rolling out, these apps are getting better each day, with options for customizability and accurate weather information.

With so many options available, determining which app is best for your needs can be difficult.

author: Andrea Earnest
excerpt: The weather service said the severe weather threat is for 3 to 11 p.m. Friday.
abstract:
The weather service said the severe weather threat is for 3 to 11 p.m. Friday.

Reply

ILLINOIS — Severe thunderstorms are expected Friday as damaging winds and rain-wrapped tornadoes are possible, according to the National Service.

Most of the Chicago area is under a slight risk for severe weather, with areas to the west under an enhanced risk. In northwest Illinois, near the Iowa-Illinois border, the severe weather threat is moderate, according to the weather service.

The weather service said the severe weather threat is for 3 to 11 p.

title: Storms with hail, strong wind possible in North Texas on Thursday, Friday
author: Harriet Ramos
excerpt: The threat of severe weather in Dallas-Fort Worth is low Thursday, according to the NWS.
abstract:
Thunderstorms and some severe weather are possible in North Texas on Thursday and Friday, according to the National Weather Service in Fort Worth.
Residents could see some drizzle and light rain Thursday morning and there is a chance of thunderstorms in the afternoon, according to NWS meteorologist Sarah Barnes.
The chance of severe weather is low for the Dallas-Fort Worth area on Thursday, Barnes said. If severe storms do develop, they will likely be north of the Metroplex.
The greatest threat from those storms would be hail, according to Barnes.

title: The Best Weather Apps for iPhone
author: Chris Hoffman
excerpt: Whether you're looking out for rainy days or enjoy a bit of amateur meteorology in your spare time, there are plenty of great weather apps for your iPhone. From free to feature-rich to futuristic, we…
abstract:
Jason Fitzpatrick / How-To Geek


Whether you're looking out for rainy days or enjoy a bit of amateur meteorology in your spare time, there are plenty of great weather apps for your iPhone. From free to feature-rich to futuristic, we have some great recommendations to share.
 



Best anything is always a subjective call, and in the case of the best weather apps for iOS, what makes one app a must-have download and turns you into a lifelong fan may not even be on the radar for another person.


For some people, that must-have feature might be an elegant or novel interface, a really polished weather radar, pollen or air quality alerts, or any number of things relevant to their health, hobbies, or job.

title: National Weather Service dragged for 'Transgender Day of Visibility' tweet: 'Just do the weather'
author: Adam Sabes
excerpt: The National Weather Service is being hit on Twitter after promising 'International Transgender Day of Visibility" in a post on Friday.
abstract:
The National Weather Service was criticized on Twitter for promoting the "Transgender Day of Visibility."
"To promote justice, equality, and equity for the transgender community, the National Weather Service family champions and stands alongside our transgender employees on this day and every day!" the National Weather Service posted on Twitter on Friday.
Conservative columnist Buzz Patterson tweeted in response "Just do the weather. Thanks."
Comedian Tim young tweeted, "Stick to reporting on the weather.

Forecasters warn of late-week severe weather threat
AccuWeather forecasters say a storm system will bring another round of severe weather to the South Central states late this week.
For the second Friday in a row, Middle Tennessee is expected to see severe weather, according to the National Weather Service.
Showers and thunderstorms
 in the area could bring severe storms and damaging winds Friday night into Saturday morning, according to NWS. With winds up to 60 mph and the possibility of a tornado.

Forecasters warn of late-week severe weather threat
AccuWeather forecasters say a storm system will bring another round of severe weather to the South Central states late this week.
For the second consecutive Friday, Middle Tennessee is expected to experience severe weather, according to the National Weather Service.
"Our main concern remains damaging straight-line winds with gusts 60+ mph," NWS Nashville said.
Though the risk for isolated tornadoes and hail are low, they cannot be ruled out. Localized, brief downpours are also possible, but widespread flooding is not expected, the forecast showed.

Friday afternoon and evening will see the highest risk of severe weather, continuing into Saturday until about 1 a.m., according to NWS Memphis.

abstract:
Severe weather including strong winds, large hail and maybe a tornado or two is possible in the Kansas City area Tuesday as a couple rounds of thunderstorms sweep through Missouri, according to the National Weather Service.
While central and northeast Missouri are at greater risk of seeing high impact severe weather, the National Weather Service's Storm Prediction Center has placed Kansas City and surrounding area under a slight risk of severe thunderstorms. The rating means that scattered severe storms are possible, but are not expect to be widespread.

title: Thunderstorms, gusty winds expected in CT Saturday, weather service says
author: Austin Mirmina
excerpt: Warnings of thunderstorms, gusty winds and hail have been issued for five of the state's...
abstract:
Steady showers and warmer-than-average temperatures during the day are expected to transition into evening thunderstorms and hazardous conditions throughout Connecticut on Saturday, the national weather service says.

The weather service forecasts that morning rain and breezy winds across the state will last throughout the day, with thunderstorms possible in the mid-afternoon. Temperatures will be in the mid-to-high 60s, which is several degrees warmer on average for April.

Daytime precipitation amounts could range from a quarter to a half of an inch, depending on the location, according to the national weather service.

title: More severe weather in North Texas Tuesday forecast with large hail, tornadoes possible
author: Harriet Ramos
excerpt: Storms will be possible beginning Tuesday afternoon, but the greatest threat for severe storms is around 2 a.m. Wednesday along and east of Interstate 35.
abstract:
The threat of severe weather returns to the North Texas forecast on Tuesday with the possibility of large hail, damaging winds and tornadoes, according to the National Weather Service in Fort Worth.
There is also an elevated fire threat west of Interstate 35 behind a dryline, officials said.
Madi Gordon, a NWS meteorologist, said some storms may develop late Tuesday afternoon ahead of they dryline along and east of I-35, with a second round possible early Wednesday morning.
If storms do develop Tuesday, Gordon said, all manner of weather, including large hail, damaging winds and tornadoes are possible.

title: Severe weather possible in the Tri-State on Friday evening
excerpt: The National Weather Service says severe weather is possible in the Tri-State on Friday evening.
abstract:
The National Weather Service says severe weather is possible in the Tri-State on Friday evening as a potent springtime storm system sweeps through the region.
Here's what they're saying about the forecast.
A couple of the ingredients needed for severe weather − wind shear and moisture − will be readily available, according to the weather service. Justin Gibbs, a meteorlogist for the agency, said the big question is whether there will be enough instability to fuel severe thunderstorms.
High temperatures are expected to reach the upper 60s on Friday, and it's going to feel muggy by March standards, with dew points in the lower 60s.

title: Kansas City under severe thunderstorm watch Tuesday evening until midnight: NWS
author: Bill Lukitsch
excerpt: Potential threats include tornadoes, tennis-ball-sized hail and wind gusts as high as 70 miles per hour.
abstract:
The National Weather Service was warning Kansas Citians of potentially dangerous weather on Tuesday evening as the metro area was put on notice for severe thunderstorms, tornadoes and heavy hail.
The weather service placed Kansas City and several parts of northwestern Missouri and northeastern Kansas under a severe thunderstorm watch. The latest warning comes amid strong storms observed Tuesday evening in Holt County, north of St. Joseph.
Under the thunderstorm watch, the weather service advised of one or two tornadoes as a possibility, along with scattered hail the size of tennis balls.

title: First Alert Weather: All severe threats possible across North Texas today
author: Dominic Brown
excerpt: Your CBS News Texas First Alert Weather Team is keeping a close eye on a likely active weather day in North Texas this afternoon and evening. In fact, all modes of severe weather are possible.
abstract:
NORTH TEXAS (CBSNewsTexas.com) — Heads up! Today is a Weather Alert.

Your CBS News Texas First Alert Weather Team is keeping a close eye on a likely active weather day in North Texas this afternoon and evening. In fact, all modes of severe weather are possible.

The Storm Prediction Center has posted an Enhanced Risk (Level 3) for severe storms in most of North Texas, including all of the Metroplex.

This afternoon, let's stay weather aware. A warm front will continue pushing through our viewing area from the south while the dryline nudges into the area from the west.

title: Severe weather outbreak with tornadoes could impact 20 states late this week
author: FOX Weather
excerpt: The highest severe weather threat on Friday is predicted to stretch from Iowa and Illinois southward into Arkansas, northern Mississippi and West and Middle Tennessee. Tornadoes, damaging wind gust…
abstract:
March won't be going out like a lamb this year as a potential severe weather outbreak looms for the Plains, Midwest and South to close out the month, less than a week after a 
deadly tornado outbreak 
tore across Mississippi, Alabama and Georgia last Friday night and into the weekend.


The setup for severe weather can be traced back to a bomb cyclone that has brought another round of rain, snow and wind to California over the last few days. The upper-level jet stream disturbance responsible for this West Coast storm will sweep into the central U.

abstract:
Arkansas school districts are keeping a close watch on the possibility of severe storms Friday.
The district is constantly watching the weather, Shari Cooper, PR and communications manager for Fort Smith Public Schools, said.

abstract:

Motorists and travelers this week could expect a sunny weather that is best for outdoor activities and travel.

title: Tornadoes, large hail, strong winds possible as strong thunderstorms sweep through KC
author: Robert A. Cronkleton
excerpt: With the threat of severe weather including the possibility of tornadoes on Tuesday, the National Weather Service advises to pay attention to the forecast as it will change.
abstract:
Another round of severe weather is expected to sweep through the Kansas City area this week, bringing strong thunderstorms that could generate large hail, strong winds and tornadoes, according to the National Weather Service.
The timing of the storms will be Tuesday afternoon and evening. While central and northeast Missouri are at a greater risk of seeing the severe weather, a few tornadoes cannot be ruled out in the Kansas City metro area, the weather service said.
'It's imperative everyone keep up to date on the latest forecast, as details will emerge and change as we approach Tuesday afternoon,' the National Weather Service said.

title: Key native iPhone widget is "under the weather" after update to iOS 16.4
author: Alan Friedman
excerpt: The iOS native Weather app widget is not working for many iPhone users after the recent update to iOS 16.4.
abstract:
It seems that the iOS 16.4 update has broken a widget belonging to one of the platform's native apps. Ironically, the app that is under the weather is the Weather app. A tweet from former hockey broadcaster 
Mark Kennedy
 (via 
iPhone in Canada
) reads, "Anyone else having constant issues with the weather widget on @Apple #iPhone not loading? It's happening all the time and needs to be opened to make it work. I'm on #iPhone14Pro fully updated."
The widget for the iPhone home screen simply states "No weather data.

title: As climate change intensifies extreme weather, NOAA looks to startups to help improve its forecasts
author: Magdalena Petrova
excerpt: NOAA is exploring buying data from startups such as Tomorrow.io and Saildrone to help it improve its weather forecasting.
abstract:
The U.S. experienced 18 separate billion-dollar weather or climate disasters in 2022, costing a total of $165 billion in damages. The disasters were also deadly, causing at least 474 direct or indirect fatalities, according to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.

In the U.S., NOAA is in charge of tracking weather and disseminating forecasts. It's a complicated job that begins with collecting billions of observations per day on metrics such as temperature, wind speed and moisture.

:

Weather Forecasting Services help businesses, governments, and individuals make informed decisions related to weather-sensitive activities such as agriculture, aviation, transportation, and energy production.

This year, the Easter long weekend takes place from 
April 7 until April 10
. It's the first significant break in the year, meaning it's

. Before you go ahead and plan your 
weekend away though
, you might want to consider what the weather is doing around Easter. We've consulted the long-range weather forecast to help you out.

Australian capital city weather forecasts

Bureau of Meteorology
 and 
Accuweather
.

excerpt: Start your day with the latest weather news – A powerful storm system that has ripped through the U.S. this week will enter its final chapter Thursday with severe weather possible in the mid-Atlantic…
abstract:
Welcome to the Daily Weather Update from FOX Weather. It's Thursday, April 6, 2023. Start your day the right way with everything you need to know about today's weather. You can also get a quick briefing of national, regional and local weather whenever you like with the FOX Weather Update podcast.
After days of deadly severe weather tearing through the central U.S. this week, the storm system behind the trouble could be problematic for the mid-Atlantic on Thursday. Severe storms are possible along the Interstate 95 corridor from Baltimore south through Washington and Richmond, Virginia.

Most of the Chicago area is under a slight risk for severe weather, with areas to the west under an enhanced risk. In northwest Illinois, near the Iowa-Illinois border, the severe weather threat is moderate, according to the weather service.

title: Storms with hail, strong wind possible in North Texas on Thursday, Friday
author: Harriet Ramos
excerpt: The threat of severe weather in Dallas-Fort Worth is low Thursday, according to the NWS.
abstract:
Thunderstorms and some severe weather are possible in North Texas on Thursday and Friday, according to the National Weather Service in Fort Worth.
Residents could see some drizzle and light rain Thursday morning and there is a chance of thunderstorms in the afternoon, according to NWS meteorologist Sarah Barnes.
The chance of severe weather is low for the Dallas-Fort Worth area on Thursday, Barnes said. If severe storms do develop, they will likely be north of the Metroplex.
The greatest threat from those storms would be hail, according to Barnes.

title: The Best Weather Apps for iPhone
author: Chris Hoffman
excerpt: Whether you're looking out for rainy days or enjoy a bit of amateur meteorology in your spare time, there are plenty of great weather apps for your iPhone. From free to feature-rich to futuristic, we…
abstract:
Jason Fitzpatrick / How-To Geek


Whether you're looking out for rainy days or enjoy a bit of amateur meteorology in your spare time, there are plenty of great weather apps for your iPhone. From free to feature-rich to futuristic, we have some great recommendations to share.
 



Best anything is always a subjective call, and in the case of the best weather apps for iOS, what makes one app a must-have download and turns you into a lifelong fan may not even be on the radar for another person.


For some people, that must-have feature might be an elegant or novel interface, a really polished weather radar, pollen or air quality alerts, or any number of things relevant to their health, hobbies, or job.

title: 5 best weather apps for Android in 2023
author: Anshuman Panda
excerpt: From the plethora of weather apps available on the Play Store, it can sometimes be a headache when choosing the best app for you.
abstract:
From the plethora of weather apps available on the Play Store, it can sometimes be a headache when choosing the best app for you. Staying up to date with the weather forecast is easier than ever in 2023, thanks to the abundance of weather apps available for Android users.

Some apps come with a clean user experience and support for various widgets. With the new Android versions rolling out, these apps are getting better each day, with options for customizability and accurate weather information.

With so many options available, determining which app is best for your needs can be difficult.

title: National Weather Service dragged for 'Transgender Day of Visibility' tweet: 'Just do the weather'
author: Adam Sabes
excerpt: The National Weather Service is being hit on Twitter after promising 'International Transgender Day of Visibility" in a post on Friday.
abstract:
The National Weather Service was criticized on Twitter for promoting the "Transgender Day of Visibility."
"To promote justice, equality, and equity for the transgender community, the National Weather Service family champions and stands alongside our transgender employees on this day and every day!" the National Weather Service posted on Twitter on Friday.
Conservative columnist Buzz Patterson tweeted in response "Just do the weather. Thanks."
Comedian Tim young tweeted, "Stick to reporting on the weather.

title: Nashville weather: Middle TN expected to see severe weather Friday
author: Joyce Orlando
excerpt: Middle Tennessee could see severe storms for the second Friday in a row, according the National Weather Service. Here's what to expect.
abstract:
Forecasters warn of late-week severe weather threat
AccuWeather forecasters say a storm system will bring another round of severe weather to the South Central states late this week.
For the second Friday in a row, Middle Tennessee is expected to see severe weather, according to the National Weather Service.
Showers and thunderstorms
 in the area could bring severe storms and damaging winds Friday night into Saturday morning, according to NWS. With winds up to 60 mph and the possibility of a tornado.

title: Nashville weather: Severe storm risk overnight Friday for Middle TN
author: Rachel Wegner
excerpt: Middle Tennessee could see severe storms for the second Friday in a row, according the National Weather Service. Here's what to expect.
abstract:
Forecasters warn of late-week severe weather threat
AccuWeather forecasters say a storm system will bring another round of severe weather to the South Central states late this week.
For the second consecutive Friday, Middle Tennessee is expected to experience severe weather, according to the National Weather Service.
"Our main concern remains damaging straight-line winds with gusts 60+ mph," NWS Nashville said.
Though the risk for isolated tornadoes and hail are low, they cannot be ruled out. Localized, brief downpours are also possible, but widespread flooding is not expected, the forecast showed.

author: Dima Amro
excerpt: Memphis will likely see severe weather Friday with the possibility of thunderstorms, tornadoes and hail, according to the National Weather Service.
abstract:
The Memphis area Friday stands at a moderate risk for severe weather and will likely see severe storms as well as possible tornadoes and hail, according to the National Weather Service in Memphis.
Friday afternoon and evening will see the highest risk of severe weather, continuing into Saturday until about 1 a.m., according to NWS Memphis.
Beginning Thursday night, temperatures will dip to 60 degrees and Shelby County will see storm clouds roll in with a 60% chance of showers and thunderstorms between 2 a.

title: Severe weather, including a squall line of thunderstorms, possible in Kansas City area
author: Robert A. Cronkleton
excerpt: A squall line of thunderstorms could develop along a cold front that is expected to sweep through the Kansas City area Tuesday evening, according to the National Weather Service.
abstract:
Severe weather including strong winds, large hail and maybe a tornado or two is possible in the Kansas City area Tuesday as a couple rounds of thunderstorms sweep through Missouri, according to the National Weather Service.
While central and northeast Missouri are at greater risk of seeing high impact severe weather, the National Weather Service's Storm Prediction Center has placed Kansas City and surrounding area under a slight risk of severe thunderstorms. The rating means that scattered severe storms are possible, but are not expect to be widespread.

title: More severe weather in North Texas Tuesday forecast with large hail, tornadoes possible
author: Harriet Ramos
excerpt: Storms will be possible beginning Tuesday afternoon, but the greatest threat for severe storms is around 2 a.m. Wednesday along and east of Interstate 35.
abstract:
The threat of severe weather returns to the North Texas forecast on Tuesday with the possibility of large hail, damaging winds and tornadoes, according to the National Weather Service in Fort Worth.
There is also an elevated fire threat west of Interstate 35 behind a dryline, officials said.
Madi Gordon, a NWS meteorologist, said some storms may develop late Tuesday afternoon ahead of they dryline along and east of I-35, with a second round possible early Wednesday morning.
If storms do develop Tuesday, Gordon said, all manner of weather, including large hail, damaging winds and tornadoes are possible.

title: Thunderstorms, gusty winds expected in CT Saturday, weather service says
author: Austin Mirmina
excerpt: Warnings of thunderstorms, gusty winds and hail have been issued for five of the state's...
abstract:
Steady showers and warmer-than-average temperatures during the day are expected to transition into evening thunderstorms and hazardous conditions throughout Connecticut on Saturday, the national weather service says.

The weather service forecasts that morning rain and breezy winds across the state will last throughout the day, with thunderstorms possible in the mid-afternoon. Temperatures will be in the mid-to-high 60s, which is several degrees warmer on average for April.

Daytime precipitation amounts could range from a quarter to a half of an inch, depending on the location, according to the national weather service.

title: Nashville weather: Severe storms, high winds possible overnight in Middle TN
author: Rachel Wegner
excerpt: Severe storms are expected to push through Middle Tennessee late Friday night into early Saturday morning. Follow along here for updates.
abstract:
The risk of severe storms kicks off late Friday night across Middle Tennessee.
Strong to severe storms will be moving into the Middle Tennessee area between 9 p.m. Friday and 3 a.m. Saturday, according to the Nashville Weather Service.
Here's the latest on tonight's severe weather risk. Our messaging has not changed. Damaging straight-line winds are the primary threat with gusts of 60+ mph. Isolated tornadoes can't be ruled out,. 
#TNwx
 
pic.twitter.com/iG9yq7PEh5
— NWS Nashville (@NWSNashville) 
March 31, 2023
Damaging straight-line winds will be the primary threat, with winds up to 60 mph.

title: Severe weather possible in the Tri-State on Friday evening
excerpt: The National Weather Service says severe weather is possible in the Tri-State on Friday evening.
abstract:
The National Weather Service says severe weather is possible in the Tri-State on Friday evening as a potent springtime storm system sweeps through the region.
Here's what they're saying about the forecast.
A couple of the ingredients needed for severe weather − wind shear and moisture − will be readily available, according to the weather service. Justin Gibbs, a meteorlogist for the agency, said the big question is whether there will be enough instability to fuel severe thunderstorms.
High temperatures are expected to reach the upper 60s on Friday, and it's going to feel muggy by March standards, with dew points in the lower 60s.

title: Kansas City under severe thunderstorm watch Tuesday evening until midnight: NWS
author: Bill Lukitsch
excerpt: Potential threats include tornadoes, tennis-ball-sized hail and wind gusts as high as 70 miles per hour.
abstract:
The National Weather Service was warning Kansas Citians of potentially dangerous weather on Tuesday evening as the metro area was put on notice for severe thunderstorms, tornadoes and heavy hail.
The weather service placed Kansas City and several parts of northwestern Missouri and northeastern Kansas under a severe thunderstorm watch. The latest warning comes amid strong storms observed Tuesday evening in Holt County, north of St. Joseph.
Under the thunderstorm watch, the weather service advised of one or two tornadoes as a possibility, along with scattered hail the size of tennis balls.

title: First Alert Weather: All severe threats possible across North Texas today
author: Dominic Brown
excerpt: Your CBS News Texas First Alert Weather Team is keeping a close eye on a likely active weather day in North Texas this afternoon and evening. In fact, all modes of severe weather are possible.
abstract:
NORTH TEXAS (CBSNewsTexas.com) — Heads up! Today is a Weather Alert.

Your CBS News Texas First Alert Weather Team is keeping a close eye on a likely active weather day in North Texas this afternoon and evening. In fact, all modes of severe weather are possible.

The Storm Prediction Center has posted an Enhanced Risk (Level 3) for severe storms in most of North Texas, including all of the Metroplex.

This afternoon, let's stay weather aware. A warm front will continue pushing through our viewing area from the south while the dryline nudges into the area from the west.

title: Millions warned tornadoes are 'expected' Friday: Nashville, Memphis, Little Rock at risk
author: USA TODAY
excerpt: Thursday will bring more snow to mountains in the West while the central U.S. braces for dangerous storms on Friday.
abstract:
Friday updates: Read the latest weather news here.
Thursday is the day to prepare for what's expected to be a wild and potentially dangerous Friday weatherwise across a large swath of the central U.S.
Forecasters are warning of an outbreak of severe weather Friday afternoon and evening in at least 12 states from the Upper Midwest to the Deep South: "Intense, damaging gusts and several tornadoes (some strong and long-track) are expected," the Storm Prediction Center said.
Tens of millions of people live where the high winds and tornadoes are possible: Big cities in the highest danger areas include Nashville, Memphis, St.

title: Nashville weather: Severe storms, high winds possible overnight in Middle TN
author: Rachel Wegner
excerpt: Severe storms are expected to push through Middle Tennessee late Friday night into early Saturday morning. Follow along here for updates.
abstract:
The risk of severe storms kicks off late Friday night across Middle Tennessee.
Strong to severe storms will be moving into the Middle Tennessee area between 9 p.m. Friday and 3 a.m. Saturday, according to the Nashville Weather Service.
Damaging straight-line winds will be the primary threat, with winds up to 60 mph.
Isolated threats of tornadoes will be highest over the southwest portions of Middle Tennessee.
A small portion of the weather will follow residents into what is forecasted to be a sunny Saturday: a wind advisory will be in effect starting at 7 p.

title: Arkansas school districts monitoring Friday weather
author: DMM
excerpt: Arkansas school districts are keeping a close watch on the possibility of severe storms Friday.
abstract:
Arkansas school districts are keeping a close watch on the possibility of severe storms Friday.
The district is constantly watching the weather, Shari Cooper, PR and communications manager for Fort Smith Public Schools, said.
Load Error
If you feel more comfortable keeping your child home until the weather passes, that's up to you, she said.
The district has safe rooms at every school.
"The Fort Smith Public School system has safe rooms and tornado shelters at all of our schools," Cooper said. "Every single school has that capacity to bring our students into the safe places during severe weather.

title: Tornadoes, large hail, strong winds possible as strong thunderstorms sweep through KC
author: Robert A. Cronkleton
excerpt: With the threat of severe weather including the possibility of tornadoes on Tuesday, the National Weather Service advises to pay attention to the forecast as it will change.
abstract:
Another round of severe weather is expected to sweep through the Kansas City area this week, bringing strong thunderstorms that could generate large hail, strong winds and tornadoes, according to the National Weather Service.
The timing of the storms will be Tuesday afternoon and evening. While central and northeast Missouri are at a greater risk of seeing the severe weather, a few tornadoes cannot be ruled out in the Kansas City metro area, the weather service said.
'It's imperative everyone keep up to date on the latest forecast, as details will emerge and change as we approach Tuesday afternoon,' the National Weather Service said.

title: UK Weather Forecast: Sunny Weather Outlook Likely in UK This April After Rounds of Heavy Rain
author: Kenneth John
excerpt: The latest weather forecast in the United Kingdom reported a sunny weather outlook this week after Brits experienced rounds of heavy rain and winter storms. Read here.
abstract:
According to the latest weather forecasts, a sunny outlook is expected in the United Kingdom this week after experiencing rounds of heavy rain and winter storms.
 
Motorists and travelers this week could expect a sunny weather that is best for outdoor activities and travel.
 
During the beginning of the year, Brits experienced severe winter storms and weather that resulted in weather alerts, challenging cold and travel hazards.
 
A sunny weather outlook is ahead in the UK

abstract:
Find more answers here!
 
 
The United States Department of Agriculture defines weather-related extreme events as those that are often short-lived and include heat waves, freezes, heavy downpours, tornadoes, tropical cyclones and floods.With strange weather occurring across the country, it is hard not to think that erratic weather patterns are becoming more frequent.
A 
climate article
 from National Public Radio highlighted that the Bulletin of the American Meteorological Society published 'Explaining Extreme Events of 2021 and 2022 from a Climate Perspective.

title: The Daily Weather Update from FOX Weather: Heavy rain to bring severe weather, flooding risk to Plains, South
author: Heather Brinkmann
excerpt: Start your day with the latest weather news – A potent storm system will bring a soaking rain and the chance of severe weather this week. Plus, below-average temperatures are in store for more than…
abstract:
Welcome to the Daily Weather Update from FOX Weather. It's Monday, April 24, 2023. Start your day the right way with everything you need to know about today's weather. You can also get a quick briefing of national, regional and local weather whenever you like with the FOX Weather Update podcast.
Another storm system will bring a soaking rain to parts of the Plains and South this week, bringing much-needed rainfall to the drought-stricken areas of Texas, Oklahoma and Kansas.
In addition to the heavy rain, there's also a threat of severe storms in central and east-central Texas on Tuesday.

title: Purple reign: Stunning aurora over Scotland
author: Steven McKenzie
excerpt: The vibrant colours of the Northern Lights overnight were picked up by aurora watchers' cameras.
abstract:
TJM/BBC Weather Watchers
Cameras reveal the vibrant colours of the aurora. This photo was taken at Carnoustie in Angus
Clear skies over parts of Scotland offered stargazers views of the Northern Lights overnight.
Powerful geomagnetic storms associated with activity on the Sun resulted in stunning displays of the Aurora Borealis.
Busta in Shetland and Port Askaig in Islay were among places across Scotland where it was visible.
BBC Weather said there could be further opportunities of spotting the aurora overnight Monday into Tuesday.

title: Hello New Weather,Hello New World: Moji Weather Attends 'Asia Climate Forum 2023'
author: World Newswire
excerpt: Recently，the Asia Climate Forum 2023 is officially launching with an exhibition in Singapore, inviting major organizations such as the World Meteorological Organization (WMO), national meteorological…
abstract: Recently，the Asia Climate Forum 2023 is officially launching with an exhibition in Singapore, inviting major organizations such as the World Meteorological Organization (WMO), national meteorological and hydrological departments, and national environmental agencies to discuss global climate change with a focus on meteorological and hydrological services worldwide. The China Meteorological Service Association is participating in this international exhibition, along with Moji Weather and other benchmark weather companies in China.

title: Stormy weather expected Monday afternoon in Tampa Bay area
author: Michaela Mulligan
excerpt: The weather service is anticipating thunderstorms on the coast of Tampa Bay and more severe weather east of Interstate 75.
abstract:
Be sure to grab an umbrella ahead of your lunch break as Monday is forecast to be stormy one.

The National Weather Service is calling for a 60% chance of showers and thunderstorms Monday afternoon, with storms likely continuing into the early evening. The weather service is anticipating the most severe weather will be east of Tampa.

'It's mostly going to be not all that unlike what we would anticipate in the summer,' said Austen Flannery, a meteorologist with the weather service's Tampa Bay office.

title: Windows' default Weather App will soon have ads and news
excerpt: The default Weather app on Windows will soon have more features, but also display advertisement and news to its users.
abstract:
Microsoft is working on an updated version of the official Windows weather application. The new version of the Weather application has new features but displays advertisement in a prominent location as well. The current version of the Weather app does not have any ads.

ADVERTISEMENT

Windows users on Windows 10 or 11 devices may load the Weather app from the Start Menu. They may also pin the app to the taskbar for fast access.

The Weather app makes a few preparations on first start before it displays weather details to the user.

title: A warm front could bring severe weather into North Texas Tuesday. Here's what we know
author: James Hartley
excerpt: The threat of severe weather conditions like hail, wind and tornadoes aren't clear yet, but there could be some early predictors on Tuesday.
abstract:
North Texans should brace for severe weather Tuesday afternoon as a warm front moves into the region, according to the National Weather Service in Fort Worth.
Quarter-sized hail, damaging winds and tornadoes are all possible, according to the weather service. The threats of severe weather aren't certain yet, and a lot of it will depend on where the warm front ends up. A good sign will be how much cloud cover clears up as the day goes on.
The biggest threats will be in Dallas-Fort Worth, to the northwest and to the southeast, then down south of Killeen, according to the National Weather Service.

title: Poll: Extreme weather leaves some worried they may have to move
author: Jennifer De Pinto
excerpt: Views on climate change as a factor are shaped by experience with extreme weather and by partisanship.
abstract:
Dealing with extreme weather is raising concerns for some Americans who feel they may be forced to eventually move out of the area where they live because of it.
Fifty-three percent of Americans report having experienced what they consider extreme weather in recent years, and nearly half of them are at least somewhat concerned that they may need to move from the area they live in now because of it.
And a big majority of those who have experienced extreme weather themselves see climate change as a major factor contributing to their concern and feel climate change needs to be addressed right away.

title: US Ignite Launches Innovative Inclement Weather Decision Support App for Fort Carson
abstract:
[April 25, 2023] US Ignite Launches Innovative Inclement Weather Decision Support App for Fort Carson

Today US Ignite announces the launch of the Inclement Weather Decision Support Application at Fort Carson, Colorado, a United States Army installation. The new AI-driven application provides operational recommendations based on real-time weather and traffic conditions. It is designed to help improve efficiency, increase commuter safety, and reduce costs for the Fort Carson installation. This press release features multimedia.

title: TV apps: Interactive weather on your big screen
excerpt: Interactive weather on your big screen. The Weather Network, MétéoMédia TV app. Try it out today!
abstract:
It's interactive. It's local. It's made for you.
Our TV app provides you with easy on-demand access to local weather information and a large library of video content on your big screen with the simple touch of your remote. From the comfort of your living room, you can access the app through your cable subscription, a Smart TV, or by purchasing a streaming device and connecting it to your TV. It's as simple as that! Our TV app is now available on BlueCurve TV with Shaw subscribers in more than 500 000 households in Canada.

title: How to Use the Weather App on Your Samsung Phone
author: Ayush Jalan
excerpt: Every Samsung phones comes with a weather app installed, although it isn't always easy to find. Here's how to set it up and use it.
abstract:
The Weather app can be difficult to find on Samsung phones considering how it doesn't show up in the Apps screen by default. Let's take a look at how to find the Weather app, explore its top features, and see how you can personalize it to your liking.
 
 How to Find the Weather App on Samsung 


The Weather app on your Samsung phone comes pre-installed, so you don't need to download it from elsewhere. However, the app does not show by default in the Apps screen, so it can be difficult to find on your phone.

title: Microsoft rains MSN news feed down on Windows 11 Weather app

abstract:
(Image credit: FireCube via Twitter)






The Weather app for Windows 11 and Windows 10 has received a significant update that's available for Insiders.
The app now has a new home page with suggestions for your day, such as if you'll need an umbrella or a jacket.
Toward the bottom of the homepage, you'll now see trending news stories.
Microsoft rolled out an update to the Weather app for Windows 11 and Windows 10 that brings a new home page and new features. The latest version of Weather also includes trending news topics, which may not be a welcome addition to everyone.

title: Weather Forecasting Services Market May Set New Growth Story
author: Adam Smith
excerpt: In 2022, the global weather forecasting services market recorded valuation of US$3.6 billion and is expected to achieve a significant growth CAGR of 12.6%, resulting in a valuation of US$ 10.37 billion by 2031. The global weather forecasting services market is expected to continue its growth trajectory in the coming years, driven by ongoing technological advancements, greater […] | 2023-04-18 09:25:24
abstract:
In 2022, the global weather forecasting services market recorded valuation of US$3.6 billion and is expected to achieve a significant growth CAGR of 12.6%, resulting in a valuation of US$ 10.37 billion by 2031.

The global weather forecasting services market is expected to continue its growth trajectory in the coming years, driven by ongoing technological advancements, greater awareness of climate change impacts, and increased private sector participation. The integration of artificial intelligence, machine learning, and big data analytics will further improve forecasting accuracy and enable more customized services.

abstract:
MIAMI - The National Weather Service issued a severe thunderstorm watch for parts of Broward County amid the possibility for more flooding in the region.

Parts of South Florida is under a severe thunderstorm watch until 8 p.m. NEXT Weather

According to the weather service, the flooding watch, issued around 2:30 p.m. and not set to expire for six hours, includes Fort Lauderdale and West Palm Beach areas.

The National Weather Service's Storm Prediction Center has placed most of Broward and Miami-Dade under a marginal risk of severe weather due to the potential for heavy downpours, flooding, frequent lightning, gusty winds, and small hail.

title: Houston weather: Gloomy weather to continue into new week
author: Jhair Romero
excerpt: A cooler-than-expected and rainy Sunday will be followed by more gloomy weather,...
abstract:
A cooler-than-expected and rainy Sunday will be followed by more gloomy weather, according to the National Weather Service.

Forecasts have cool temperatures and precipitation continuing into the first days of the week before giving way to sunny skies and warmth.

"I'd call it 'unsettled,'" according to the forecast from Travis Herzog and the ABC13 Weather Team. "We should be mostly dry on Monday, but a series of upper-level disturbances passing through will bring multiple chances of rain throughout the week, peaking on Tuesday with a 60 percent chance for showers and storms.

title: 8th OSS forecasting the fight
excerpt: Although aircraft assigned to the 80th and 35th Fighter have left Kunsan for the duration of the runway's renovation, the 8th Operations Support Squadron weather flight remains dedicated to their
abstract:
KUNSAN AIR BASE, Republic of Korea – Although aircraft assigned to the 80th and 35th Fighter have left Kunsan for the duration of the runway's renovation, the 8th Operations Support Squadron weather flight remains dedicated to their mission at the 8th Fighter Wing.

Achieving air superiority is a critical condition for successful Air Force operations and Kunsan's weather flight continues to inform leaders on weather conditions that could pose a threat to personnel and assets, arming them with knowledge to make calls on weather safety precautions.

title: Cincinnati weather: Warm temperatures return, also warnings of risk of fire danger
author: Haadiza Ogwude
excerpt: The National Weather Service in Wilmington is warning of the potential for an elevated risk of fire danger Wednesday afternoon.
abstract:
Warm temperatures and dry conditions will return to the Ohio Valley Region through Thursday.
Wednesday's high in Cincinnati will be around 81 with sunny skies, according to the 
National Weather Service
.
Due to warm, dry and sunny weather combined with increasing winds, the National Weather Service in Wilmington also warns of the potential for an elevated risk of fire danger on Wednesday. The weather service has issued a 
hazardous weather outlook through Thursday afternoon
. The outlook is for areas in East Central and Southeast Indiana; Northeast and Northern Kentucky and South Central and Southwest Ohio.

title: How to Check the Weather on Your Roku
author: Chris Hoffman
excerpt: There are countless ways to check weather reports on all your devices, but what about your Roku TV or streaming device? Here's how to get weather information on the biggest screen in your home.
abstract:
Corbin Davenport / How-To Geek


There are countless ways to check weather reports on all your devices, but what about your 
Roku TV
 or 
streaming device
? Here's how to get weather information on the biggest screen in your home.


The Roku operating system doesn't have a built-in weather app or screensaver, or even a simple panel with the current temperature. However, there is some live weather content available through the built-in Roku Channel, and channels developed by other companies can give you on-demand information.

title: Tackling construction weather safety head-on with AI
excerpt: New emerging AI-backed weather intelligence technology is changing the game with hyper local, actionable insights, providing all corners of the organization with the information they need to make…
abstract:
Picture this: It's a sunny, clear day when you and your crews arrive to a job site. You begin on schedule after the morning safety briefing, without any weather alerts or warnings. Then, two hours later, a powerful thunderstorm strikes without warning, halting progress and putting your workers in danger.


Sound familiar?


Weather-related risks pose a significant threat to the construction industry. Everyday conditions, such as heavy rain, high winds, and lightning, can delay projects, increase costs, and, most importantly, threaten worker safety.

title: Over 4M at risk of severe weather in Texas; winter storm warning in Colorado: Tuesday forecast
author: Jordan Mendoza
excerpt: The National Weather Service said severe weather is possible in the south-central U.S., particularly in central and northern Texas.
abstract:
The Upper Midwest and northern Plains were bracing for historic river flooding Tuesday, where some areas could see the worst in 20 years. Meanwhile, severe storms were possible across portions of Texas on Tuesday afternoon and evening.
"A one-two punch of severe weather is in store across the southern Plains both Tuesday and Wednesday," AccuWeather Meteorologist Brandon Buckingham said.
In Texas, more than 4 million people were under a severe weather threat Tuesday.
And Colorado isn't free from wintry conditions yet.

title: These Weather Apps Actually Care About Your Privacy
author: Khamosh Pathak
excerpt: Check out the weather forecast without worrying you're being tracked and your data is being sold.
abstract:
Weather apps are notoriously easy to build and extremely difficult to police. Any developer can whip up an interface from a template, add a weather API (there are loads of them), and put it up on the App Store. That 'innocent' weather app can then serve you ads, track your usage, and sell your data, including your location history. Even large companies like 
AccuWeather
 and 
Weather Channel
 were found sharing private user data with the highest bidder, even when users had expressly opted out.
If you're currently using a weather app, it's time for a privacy check.

There will be periods of mountain snow and rain accompanied by gusty winds during the period, the U.

title: Severe weather risk in Florida; temperatures cool in East but warm in West: Monday forecast
author: Jordan Mendoza
excerpt: It'll be a contrast in weather in the West and East, with chilly conditions on one side and some summer-like heat on the other. Monday's forecast.
abstract:
After some turbulent weather hit Oklahoma and the central U.S. with 
tornadoes last week
, potential severe weather will be focused on Florida to begin the week, as spring chill conditions will overtake much of the country. 
There will be a wide spectrum of temperatures stretching across the country this week. Warm temperatures have already arrived for those in the Southwest, while cool temperatures have yetto leave in the Great Lakes and Northeast, which has seen roller coaster-like temperature changes in recent weeks.

title: Sensible Weather Gets Investment
author: Paola Mendez
excerpt: Amid a year of particularly rough and unprecedented storms in Southern California, Santa Monica-based Sensible Weather Co. is allowing travelers to more confidently plan their trips. The climate-risk…
abstract:
Amid a year of particularly rough and unprecedented storms in Southern California, Santa Monica-based Sensible Weather Co. is allowing travelers to more confidently plan their trips. The climate-risk technology company landed an investment earlier this year from EP Golf Ventures, a partnership fund that is owned by the Professional Golfers Association of America and Elysian Park Ventures.


The PGA said it plans to offer Sensible Weather's protection service to its base of nearly 28,000 professional golfers.

title: Twitter limiting automatic tweets affects severe weather services
author: Austin Chaney
excerpt: A social media platform is making changes that could make it harder for you to receive critical weather information.
abstract:
A social media platform is making changes that could make it harder for you to receive critical weather information.
Channel 9 Meteorologist Austin Chaney delved into what's happening and what's the best solution to keep you safe.
As a meteorologist, Chaney's duty is to keep people informed on the multiple ways they can receive warnings in times of severe weather.
In today's day and age, one of those methods is Twitter. However, Twitter has made a change recently that significantly limits the number of automated tweets accounts can send out.

 said after a day with highs in the 60s, changes will arrive for the Denver metro area on Tuesday.
 
A 
Pinpoint Weather Alert Day
